Breadth-First.Explanation: Introductory setup with no specific hypothesis, preparing for broad clue collection.
Beginning broad observation of the image, listing general impressions.
Divergent listing of architectural features without a focused hypothesis.
Noting distinctive centerpiece as one of many clues in a broad survey.
Recording signage clue in a broad, descriptive manner.
Continuing broad catalog of layout details.
After confirming the museum, shifting to explore a finer-grained neighborhood context.

Depth-First.Explanation: Based on key architectural and display clues, a specific location hypothesis is proposed.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: Natural History Museum in London

Depth-First.Explanation: Gathering targeted details about the museum to verify the hypothesis.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Museum features: Romanesque Revival architecture, Hintze Hall, ‘Hope’ whale skeleton

Depth-First.Explanation: Convergent confirmation of the hypothesis using accumulated specific details.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Confirmation of museum identity based on architectural details and whale skeleton

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Shift from broad clue listing to generating and verifying a specific location hypothesis.
After confirming the museum, turning back to broader exploration for neighborhood context.
